field.name: DISDEFWBUF
field.description: Disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

field.name: RETTOBASE
field.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: there are preempted active exceptions to execute

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception

field.name: VECTPENDING
field.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

field.name: ISRPENDING
field.description: Interrupt pending flag, excluding NMI and Faults

field.name: ISRPREEMPT
field.description: Indicates whether a pending exception will be serviced on exit from debug halt state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: removes the pending state from the SysTick exception

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: removes the pending state from the PendSV exception

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1

register.name: AIRCR
register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

field.name: PRIGROUP
field.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority

field.name: SLEEPONEXIT
field.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

field.name: SLEEPDEEP
field.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

field.name: NONBASETHRDENA
field.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: processor can enter Thread mode only when no exception is active

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: processor can enter Thread mode from any level under the control of an EXC_RETURN value

field.name: USERSETMPEND
field.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

field.name: DIV_0_TRP
field.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

field.name: BFHFNMIGN
field.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: data bus faults caused by load and store instructions cause a lock-up

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: handlers running at priority -1 and -2 ignore data bus faults caused by load and store instructions

field.name: STKALIGN
field.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

field.name: PRI_15
field.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor attempted a load or store at a location that does not permit the operation
